basics.name: Jonas Kemnitzer
basics.label: Research Associate
basics.summary: Researcher, Machine Learning Engineer with focus on robotics, large language models and real world applications

work.name: Institute for Information Systems at Hof University of Applied Sciences
work.summary: Research Group "Intelligent and Learning Systems" at the Institute for Information Systems at Hof University (iisys). Pioneering and researching new AI applications to address real-world challenges, with a focus on deep learning and generative AI. Developing innovative methods for robots to learn new tasks independently and cooperate better with humans.
highlights: Published several papers on deep learning applications in information systems.

work.name: IBM Germany
work.summary: Implementation of common supervised and unsupervised machine learning algorithms for analysis, visualization, and forecasting purposes using IBM Cloud products for the AI lifecycle management and Python/Spark.
highlights: Programming a 'Pepper' robot using Node-RED and Javascript as well as the IBM IoT Platform for implementing the message processing algorithms between the devices.

volunteer.organization: Student Council of Hof University of Applied Sciences
volunteer.summary: Act as a student representative for the faculty of computer science. Organize events and activities for students, and represent their interests in meetings with faculty and administration.

education.area: Master of Science in Computer Science

courses: Korean Language, Java Programming, VR Application Development

education.area: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science

publications.name: Enhhancing Fitness Visualization: Application and Efficacy of Realistic Inpainting using Diffusion Models
publications.summary: In this paper we present a stable-diffusion based zero-shot approach to realistically transform the image of a human body into a more fit version of that depicted person. Therefore we combine a modified stable diffusion model with inpainting techniques and incorporated constraints. We introduce a prototype which allows users to upload a photo and visualize a more fit version of themselves. We evaluated our approach in various experiments and focused on the applicability and effectiveness of these techniques, with attention to gender-specific results.

projects.name: Explainable AI (XAI)
projects.summary: Theoretical analysis as well as implementation of the Local Interpretable Model-agnostic Explanations (LIME) algorithm in the context of a classification problem for the Youtube Comments Spam Prediction Dataset.

projects.name: Fullstack App
projects.summary: Analysis and implementation of a full-stack timetabling software. The program logic was implemented using Java and the Java Spring Framework for embedded REST functionalities, in-memory databases and profile management. Additionally, the Lombok library was integrated. The Angular web framework was used for the front end. Furthermore, technologies such as Docker and Liquibase were integrated for modularization and database versioning.

projects.name: RESTful Webservice
projects.summary: Ideation and implementation of a RESTful Webservice using Java and the Jersey RESTful Framework. A range of functionality such as Caching, Hypermedia, and Databases was used to build a modern solution of a web service.

projects.name: Data Analysis
projects.summary: Analysis and evaluation of Germany-wide migraine data using R as part of a research project called "Mira" of the Institute for Information Systems at Hof University of Applied Sciences. The project focused on the development of a web application for the visualization of migraine data.

projects.name: Design and Implementation of a VR-System
projects.summary: This project was part of the course Virtual-Reality Applications. The goal was to design and implement a prototype VR environment by using modern VR technologies like tracking devices and popular VR headsets. The environment was created using Blender.

projects.name: Java Entry Level Software Development
projects.summary: This was a small project for the Course Software Engineering Internship. I created a small application that could manage time and schedules for employees. The backend was purely based on Java code. The frontend was coded using the JavaScene builder included in Eclipse IDE
